sktemplate.name: Browser computability check - meirav
sktemplate.template:
<form id="webAuthenSupportForm" method="post">
    <input type="hidden" name="webAuthenSupport" id="webAuthenSupport">
    <button type="hidden" data-skcomponent="skbutton" data-skbuttontype="form-submit" class="hidden-button"  data-skbuttonvalue="submit" data-skform="webAuthenSupportForm" id="autoSubmit">Next</button>
</form>

nodeDescription.value: Check if the end users devices supports FIDO devices and grab necessary items for it
Setting the Device variable with the new filtered and prepared Device list to be easily referenced later in the flow. Variables Updated: devcies, deviceCount, rpid, origin
Remove any devices such as WebAuthN device if the user-agent used by browser does not support it. As well as enrich each device for the end user experiences

nodeDescription.value: Which device was selected, if none it will assume the user is attempting to pair the PingID applications
Screen to register selected device if required

rules.message: Email must be in proper format

nodeDescription.value: Setting the selected device variables to be refered later: Variables being updated: selectedDeviceIcon and selectedDeviceType
With the device list already being prepped beforehand. If the user has multiple devices, JS here will grab the device from the list for us to user later.
Creating the EMAIL, SMS, VOICE or OATH device, with activation status as ACTIVATION REQUIRED
Check to see if the device was a YUBIKEY
Creating the YUBIKEY device, with activation status as ACTIVE
Creating the TOTP device, with activation status as ACTIVATION REQUIRED
Creating the QR code to display for Authenticator app pairing
After pairing the device, ensure that it is set to ACTIVE
Create the FIDO2 device with activation status as ACTIVATION REQUIRED
This node will look through the registered devices to understand if the Max limit was hit and if the user is required to register mandatory devices
Look at the value of the button the end user selected
Does the user have remaining mandatory devices to register
Prompt to register another device
After pairing the previous device, read the users device to check if they are required to pair anything more.
Process the registered devices, and update the useable device list if needed
Process the registered devices, and update the useable device list if needed

nodeTitle.value: Is the User in the Mandatory Flow?

nodeDescription.value: Has the user already said no to register another device, but we require them to finish registering the remaining devices.
Process the registered devices, and update the useable device list if needed
Does the user have remaining mandatory devices to register
Return back to the main flow with the following attributes - userId, flowInteractionId
Look at the value of the button the end user selected
This function will look at the bypassMFA Company variable to determine the date set and todays day to see if the user is allowed to bypass MFA.
Look at the value of the button the end user selected
Delete the device in order to create a new one to resent an OTP Pairing code
Creating the EMAIL, SMS, VOICE or OATH device, with activation status as ACTIVATION REQUIRED in order to repair a new device

customHTML.value:
Bypass MFA?

Your administrator has allowed you to bypass mandatory
MFA device registration of {{global.parameters.minimumNumberOfDevices}} devices until {{global.parameters.byPassMFADate}}.
You currently have {{local.0kugrkke7m.payload.output.rawResponse.size}} MFA devices registered.

Do you want to bypass MFA registration or register MFA devices.

nodeDescription.value: Allows the user to bypass MFA registration till a certain date
Based on the response from the custom function, either force the user to register an MFA device or give them a choice

nodeTitle.value: Read the MFA devices for a user

nodeDescription.value: Read the MFA devices that a user already has
Has the user registered for the minimum number of devices
Process the registered devices, and update the useable device list if needed
